Source Notes: Neutral greeting you can use all day.
Most common way to get someone’s attention in England.

Source: Could you speak a bit slower, please?
Target: Could you speak a little slower, please?
Pronunciation (IPA): /kʊd ju spik ə ˈlɪtəl ˈsloʊɚ, pliz/
Pronunciation (Simplified): /kud yoo speek ə ˈli-təl ˈsloh-er, pleez/

Source: How do you say … in English?
Target: How do you say … in English?

Source: Could we get the bill, please?
Target: Can we get the check, please?

Source Notes: “Toilet” is the usual word in the UK; “loo” is very informal.

Target: Can I pay with a card?
